alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 5:44PM EDT until July 31 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following county, Whitley. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 543 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mountain Ash, Saxton, Pleasant View, Red Ash, Emlyn, Packard, Lot, Polly Camp, Dixie, Nevisdale, Verne, Gatliff, Ayers, Jellico Creek, Zion Hill and Wilkerson.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
